On 02/02/2006 09:20 PM, J. B. Rainsberger apparently said:
> Jason Rogers wrote:
>
> > I have often found that there are other ways around using reflection in
> > Java.  The Adaptor pattern for instance is a simple way of implementing
> > the Pluggable Selector.  It will respond to refactorings, it doesn't add
> > much complexity, and it's efficient.
>
> Really? How does Adapter do this?
My point was that instead of using string-based reflection, you have a 
collection of Adaptors that you can iterate over to get the same 
behavior.  How do you get the adaptors?  Use a Factory.

-- 
Jason Rogers
